sentence.text: Thus, research directed at expanding our current understanding of transcriptional corepressors could negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II the future development of new cancer diagnostics, prognostics, and therapies.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Importantly, the role of negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II overexpression in adult tissues in promoting the progression of multiple cancer types through their ability to modulate the transcription of developmental genes ectopically is explored.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II overexpression is known to be protumorigenic and affects the regulation of gene networks associated with "cancer hallmarks" and malignant behavior, including increased cell survival, proliferation, migration, invasion, and the epithelial-mesenchymal transition.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: As a transcriptional regulator of broad developmental processes capable of promoting malignant growth in adult tissues, therapeutically targeting the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II corepressor has the potential to be an effective method for the treatment of diverse tumor types.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
